title: How were the denominations of coins decided? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Well —- there was this coin called a Spanish dollar - Wikipedia.  It was made up of 8 Reals. It was cut into pieces to make change (“pieces of eight” for Pirate fans). The US Quarter (25 cents)  was the equivalent of “two bits” of the Spanish dollar. The Spanish dollar was legal tender for the first decades of the US, by the way,  all the way to 1857. And that is why the US has a 25 cent coin. We have also has half cents, cents, 2 cent pieces, 3 cent pieces,  5 cent pieces, 10 cent pieces, 20 cent pieces , 50 cent pieces, and dollar coins. Not to  mention $2 coins, $3 coins, $4 coins, $5 coins, $10 and $20 coins. And a $50 commemorative coin as well. Confused yet?
